Article.Title: State poll: Voters across party lines support energy competition and ...
Preview: A new statewide poll by the non-profit Conservatives for Clean Energy finds the majority of Republicans, Democrats, and unaffiliated voters across the state support more competition and consumer choice in their energy providers.
Key.Author: Liz McLaughlin

Article.Title: NC farmer attacked by bull says he's "deeply moved" by community ...
Preview: A dairy farmer viciously mauled by a bull says he is blown away by the outpouring of support from the community as he recovers at UNC Hospital. A GoFundMe page has raised more than $165,000, hundreds have signed up for volunteer shifts on the farm, and thousands have shared support online, including musician Willie Nelson.
Key.Author: Liz McLaughlin

Article.Title: Protesters gather outside of Enviva HQ to push back against pollution
Preview: Protesters gathered in front of Enviva headquarters in Raleigh to push back against the world's largest wood pellet production company for controversial renewable energy generation and pollution from plants in four North Carolina counties.
Key.Author: Liz McLaughlin

Article.Title: NC bill aims to remove barriers to nuclear energy
Preview: A North Carolina bill updating language in statutes from "renewable energy" to "clean energy" passed a key committee Tuesday, paving the way for nuclear and fusion development in the state.
Key.Author: Liz McLaughlin

Article.Title: Climate change is moving hurricane risks farther inland
Preview: As hurricane season approaches, researchers warn the risk of flooding and severe weather are moving farther inland.
Key.Author: Liz McLaughlin

Article.Title: Plant'd, a climate tech company, is developing a manufacturing ...
Preview: Plant'd, a climate tech company, is developing a manufacturing facility in Oxford to create plywood-like panels made from perennial grasses grown by local farmers. The company's co-founders say the carbon-negative materials could have a big impact on the high-emission construction industry.
Key.Author: Liz McLaughlin

Article.Title: Durham company creates unit that can destroy PFAS, other ...
Preview: Utilizing a method that was pioneered a decade ago at Duke University, Durham-based company 374Water has created the first commercial unit to destroy PFAS and other contaminants in wastewater, such as microplastics, bacteria and viruses.
Key.Author: Liz McLaughlin

Article.Title: Real meat, without the animal: Lab-grown meat makes its way to NC
Preview: Cultivated or cultured meat uses cells to grow beef, chicken and lamb without the resources needed to farm and slaughter animals. In 2024, Believer Meats is opening the first large-scale cultivated meat facility in Wilson.
Key.Author: Liz McLaughlin

Article.Title: Beloved NC farmer touched by community's love shown during ...
Preview: Randy Lewis was attacked by a bull on his farm in Alamance County. Friends have compiled a GoFundMe that has amassed more than $165,000 in donations.
Key.Author: Liz McLaughlin

Article.Title: Lab-grown meat coming to NC
Preview: Cultivated or cultured meat uses cells to grow beef, chicken and lamb without the resources needed to farm and slaughter animals. In 2024, Believer Meats is opening the first large-scale cultivated meat facility in Wilson.
Key.Author: Liz McLaughlin

Article.Title: How the proposed EPA carbon regulation could impact your energy ...
Preview: A new EPA proposal tightens restrictions of carbon emissions from the power sector, driving concerns that costs of compliance could be passed on to consumers.
Key.Author: Liz McLaughlin

Article.Title: Oxford company aims to cut carbon by using grass to build homes
Preview: Plantd, a climate tech company, is developing a manufacturing facility in Oxford to create plywood-like panels made from perennial grasses grown by local farmers. The company's co-founders say the carbon-negative materials could have a big impact on the high-emission construction industry.
Key.Author: Liz McLaughlin
